title: Can I do a B.Ed with graduation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Currently in most of the Teacher Education colleges, B. Ed. is 2 years course for which eligibility is any graduate degree with minimum 50% marks. That is why you cannot do graduation & B. Ed. together. However, there are some colleges in India which run 4 year Composite B. A +B.Ed or B. Sc + B. Ed. Program. Here in 4 years you can get two degrees together. This dual degree programs are run by Regional colleges of Education(RIEs) in Delhi, Bhopal, Ajmer, Bhuvaneshwar, Mysore & Shillong. Apart from this there are a few other colleges such as IITE in Gandhinagar, Gujarat, Ashoka in Nasik, some colleges in Pune, Kolhapur etc. You can get more info online. From year 1920–21 MHRD India is introducing this 4 year dual degree program in several universities & degree colleges all over India. This will be after 12th so you can wait for a year & do graduation & B . Ed together.

No. The minimum eligibility for the B. Ed course is 50% in graduation for general candidates and 45% for other reserved categories. However, our education minister has his plans to start a 4 year integrated course consisting of your graduation main subject and B.Ed course. If it starts, you can do. If not, then you can't.
Yes, you can do B.Ed with graduation if you admit 4 years integrated courses ie, BA B.Ed or BSc B.Ed. For details follow this website http://www.ncte.gov.in

If you are planning to get both the bachelor's degree together, I would suggest you to go for an Integrated course of B. Ed which is of 4 years duration. At the end of which you can get both the degrees simultaneously and save your time. Hope you are clear now after reading this. Good Luck.
No, B.Ed is a bachelors degree however it requires bachelors degree as its essential qualification/eligibility condition. That is why some universities consider it as a Postgraduate course.
